Jake Thompson is the assistant director of psychometrics at [Accessible Teaching, Learning, and Assessment Systems (ATLAS)](https://atlas.ku.edu), a strategic center within the [Achievement and Assessment Institute](https://aai.ku.edu) at the [University of Kansas](https://ku.edu).
He received a PhD in educational psychology and research from the University of Kansas' [School of Education and Human Sciences](https://soehs.ku.edu/) in 2018.

Jake has been the Principal Investigator for two grants funded by the [Institute of Education Sciences](https://ies.ed.gov) to develop software for the estimation and evaluation of diagnostic classification models:

* Improving Software and Methods for Estimating Diagnostic Classification Models and Evaluating Model Fit ([R305D210045](https://ies.ed.gov/funding/grantsearch/details.asp?ID=4546))
* Expanding the Functionality and Accessibility of Software for Diagnostic Measurement ([R305D240032](https://ies.ed.gov/funding/grantsearch/details.asp?ID=6075))
